sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含有"乘，骑"之意。
means: drive ： 指乘坐在有轮子的交通工具之内，控制其行驶。
ride ： 通常指骑在车、马上行驶。

sentence.Network_en: If you want a cheap ride, take a minicab.
sentence.Network_cn: 要想出行便宜，就坐小型出租车吧。

sentence.Network_en: The ride was smooth until they got into the merchant ship's wake.
sentence.Network_cn: 航行一直很顺利，直到他们碰上了商船的尾流。

sentence.Network_en: Naomi was given a pony and taught to ride side-saddle.
sentence.Network_cn: 别人给娜奥米一匹小型马并教会她如何侧骑马。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be acting in a reckless or arrogant way that invites defeat or failure
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)因莽撞（或傲慢）行动招致失败；自讨苦吃；自找麻烦

jx.jx_en_mean: for pleasure or interest, rather than any serious purpose

lj.lj_ly: Chris didn't fit in with the rest of them, but was thrilled to be along for the ride.
lj.lj_ls: 克里斯和其他人并不很合得来，但和大家一起开开心也感到兴奋。

jx.jx_en_mean: take no immediate action over something
partially depress the clutch pedal of a vehicle while driving
(N. Amer. informal)(of an athlete) sit on the sidelines rather than participate in a game or event
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)（运动员）做替补，坐冷板凳

jx.jx_en_mean: (Canadian, informal)ride on a freight train surreptitiously without paying
jx.jx_cn_mean: (加，非正式)逃票偷乘运货火车

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that someone or something has reappeared unexpectedly and with new vigour
jx.jx_cn_mean: （人或事物）出人意料地以新的活力重新出现

jx.jx_en_mean: a difficult (or easy) time doing something

lj.lj_ly: the prime minister was given a rough ride by left-wing MPs yesterday.
lj.lj_ls: 昨天首相被左派议员们折腾得厉害。

jx.jx_en_mean: trample or overtake someone while on horseback

lj.lj_ly: there is a great deal of money riding on the results of these studies.
lj.lj_ls: 有一大笔钱倚仗这些研究的结果。

jx.jx_en_mean: come safely through something, especially a storm or a period of danger or difficulty
jx.jx_cn_mean: 安然渡过（尤指风暴、危险或困难）

lj.lj_ls: 舰队已安然渡过了风暴。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rīdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rijden and German reiten

encyclopedia.content: 英国的曼彻斯特音乐潮流的形成和高潮时期与欧美流行乐大量传入国内的时刻正好擦肩而过，国内的欧美摇滚乐迷们更乐意接受同步发展的重金属和 Grunge 等形形色色的另类摇滚乐，喜欢The Stones Roses 这类曼彻斯特潮流代表乐队的乐迷甚少，知道Ride 乐队的更是缪缪无几。Ride乐队在英国乐坛的地位和名气不比 THE STONE ROSES 逊色多少。他们融合了噪音 迷幻，等多种元素的音乐风格，给人一份如斯美妙的感受。成为最具吸引人的 曼彻斯特 乐队之一。 要了解Ride这支乐队,我们很有必要认识一下另类音乐中的一个流派 ----Shoegazing .

entry.def: When you ride a horse, you sit on it and control its movements.

example.ex: I saw a girl riding a horse...
example.tran: 我看见一个骑马的女孩。

entry.tran: 骑(自行车或摩托车)；驾驶
entry.def: When you ride a bicycle or a motorcycle, you sit on it, control it, and travel along on it.

example.ex: Riding a bike is great exercise...
example.tran: 骑自行车是很好的运动。

example.ex: Two men riding on motorcycles opened fire on him...
example.tran: 两个骑摩托车的男人向他开了枪。

entry.def: When you ride in a vehicle such as a car, you travel in it.

example.ex: He prefers travelling on the Tube to riding in a limousine...
example.tran: 他更愿意乘地铁出行，不愿坐豪华轿车。

example.ex: I was riding on the back of a friend's bicycle...
example.tran: 我当时坐在一个朋友的自行车后座上。

entry.tran: (骑马、骑自行车或乘车的)旅行，旅程;车程
entry.def: A ride is a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle.

example.ex: She took some friends for a ride in the family car...
example.tran: 她开着自己的家庭轿车载着几个朋友出去兜了一圈。

example.ex: Would you like to go for a ride?...

entry.tran: (游乐场中)供骑乘的游乐设施
entry.def: In a fairground, a ride is a large machine that people ride on for fun.
If you say that one thing is riding on another, you mean that the first thing depends on the second thing.

example.ex: Billions of pounds are riding on the outcome of the election...
example.tran: 几十亿英镑都取决于这次选举的结果。

example.ex: Everything rides on the judgment of these few men.
example.tran: 一切都取决于对这几个人的判决。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is riding high, you mean that they are popular or successful at the present time.

example.ex: He was riding high in the public opinion polls...
example.tran: 他在民意调查中支持率颇高。

entry.def: If you say that someone faces a rough ride, you mean that things are going to be difficult for them because people will criticize them a lot or treat them badly.

example.ex: The Chancellor could face a rough ride unless the plan works...
example.tran: 除非这个计划能够奏效，否则财政大臣将举步维艰。

example.ex: The woman who is brave enough to pursue her own path must prepare herself for a rough ride.
example.tran: 勇于走自己道路的女人就必须准备好面对外界的非难。

entry.def: If you say that someone has been taken for a ride, you mean that they have been deceived or cheated.

example.ex: When he had not returned with my money an hour later I realized that I had been taken for a ride.
example.tran: 1个小时后他没有带着我的钱回来，我才意识到自己上当受骗了。

means.word_mean: 1. a journey in a vehicle driven by someone else;

sentences.sentence: "he took the family for a drive in his new car"

means.word_mean: 2. a mechanical device that you ride for amusement or excitement
1. sit and travel on the back of animal, usually while controlling its motions;

sentences.sentence: "She never sat a horse!"
"Did you ever ride a camel?"
"The girl liked to drive the young mare"

means.word_mean: 2. be carried or travel on or in a vehicle;

sentences.sentence: "I ride to work in a bus"
"He rides the subway downtown every day"
"Let it ride"
"The moon rode high in the night sky"

means.word_mean: 5. harass with persistent criticism or carping;

sentences.sentence: "The children teased the new teacher"
"Don't ride me so hard over my failure"
"His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie"

means.word_mean: 6. be sustained or supported or borne;

sentences.sentence: "His glasses rode high on his nose"
"The child rode on his mother's hips"
"She rode a wave of popularity"
"The brothers rode to an easy victory on their father's political name"
"This car rides smoothly"
"My new truck drives well"
"The outcomes rides on the results of the electin"
"Your grade will depends on your homework"
"Ship rides at anchor"

means.word_mean: 10. sit on and control a vehicle;

sentences.sentence: "He rides his bicycle to work every day"
"She loves to ride her new motorcycle through town"
"Shorts that ride up"
"This skirt keeps riding up my legs"
"Travel the highways of America"
"Ride the freeways of California"

means.word_mean: 13. keep partially engaged by slightly depressing a pedal with the foot;

sentences.sentence: "Don't ride the clutch!"
"The bull was riding the cow"

auth_sentence.content: It's a terrific ride from start to finish.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a terrific ride from start to finish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a terrific ride from start to finish.

auth_sentence.res_content: It's a gripping ride: a four-man one-man-band.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a gripping ride: a four-man one-man-band.

auth_sentence.res_content: Visit the 'Go-Ride Racing' website for more details.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Visit the 'Go-Ride Racing' website for more details.

Sentence.sentence: Axelrod of Home Depot, people are trying to ride out the recession by doing more themselves.

means.word_mean: 乘, 骑, 驾, 驾驭马匹, 骑马

sentences.en: She rides easy in the saddle.
sentences.cn: 她在马鞍上骑得很轻松。

sentences.en: We ride our horses in the park each morning.
sentences.cn: 我们每天早晨在公园里骑马。

means.word_mean: 乘骑, 乘坐, 搭乘

sentences.en: I had a ride on a horse for an hour.
The luxury model gives a smoother ride.
sentences.cn: 坐这种豪华型汽车感觉很平稳。

jushi.english: Will the ship be safe riding at anchor in this storm?
jushi.chinese: 这艘船停泊在暴风雨中安全吗?

jushi.english: I put a pillow on the saddle so that I could ride comfortably.
jushi.chinese: 我在鞍上放了一个枕头,这样骑马时可以舒服些。
